TopicTitle: The Lane1, my first KSP 1.0.5 creation!

Articles.Content:
Here it is in a picture showcase for you! I will have it in the 3d view thingy when I can get it to work!

This aircraft has what is known as "Supermaneuverability" It can go mach 2, but it can also maneuver like a Bi-plane, but quicker, pulling the highest of G's with it!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Any help I can get to make it faster, and more maneuverable? I can't seem to make the design any better.

I have re-designed the wings and made the Lane2! Skip to 35 seconds in to skip takeoff.

Lane3 redesign info: I put wings in the engine precooler behind the cockpit, to add lift, without external wings, its cheatsy, I know, but I couldn't find any other way of making the design fast, but also really maneuverable, so it works.

The Lane3 is the final, and best re-design, it is unstable, but easy to control and fly, the top speed in level flight with afterburner is 934 m/s, at sea level!

Skip to 1 minute 10 seconds for the most dangerous stunt.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Awesome! For moar manueverability, get the CoL right inside the CoM. Get it as far forward as possible until the CoL is only barely behind the CoM

Awesome! For moar manueverability, get the CoL right inside the CoM. Get it as far forward as possible until the CoL is only barely behind the CoM

I understand the flight model, etc, very well, I meant game mechanics, since It is already in the center of mass, directly behind the center, but not outside of it.
I believe it's as good as this design can get so far...

Ony thing that could make it even more maneuverable would be to swap out the horizontal stabilizers you used on it's tail with standard or advanced canards. More movable surface means more maneuverability. Although I don't know if they will even make a noticeable difference at this point.

Ony thing that could make it even more maneuverable would be to swap out the horizontal stabilizers you used on it's tail with standard or advanced canards. More movable surface means more maneuverability. Although I don't know if they will even make a noticeable difference at this point.

I will try, I am re-doing the wing design to start work on the Lane2.

- - - Updated - - -

Lane2 is done, will be making a video of it soon.
Lane2 video is done, I couldn't find any good recording software that was free.... so yeah..
I am adding the Lane3 modification, which is the most maneuverable, I made a video on it, and I will be putting the album together shortly.
